main event: A bright, white, stationary sphere-shaped object was observed in the sky over Salem, Massachusetts for 23 minutes on November 9, 1954.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright, white sphere, similar in size to a basketball.
The object appeared to be stationary but was jumping or moving erratically.
The object faded out of view.
The observation was made by a Lieutenant from the U.S. Coast Guard in Salem, Massachusetts.
Weather conditions at the time included winds of 22-27 knots from 320 degrees at various altitudes.
